scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
XAdES is included in 7 national catalogues. They belong to Member States which comply with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to the NIFO factsheets. 
See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement: The purpose of the specifications is not related to the publication of Open Data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
ETSI’s standards-making process has been clearly defined after years of experience. The organisation has adopted the open approach which means direct participation and consensus as a basis to develop standards. All the stakeholders have the opportunity to participate directly in the process of standardisation through the technical committees created to develop ETSI’s technical specifications and standards. The decision-making process includes a public review, where stakeholders involved can provide technical feedback in order to enhance and maximize the quality and accuracy of the standards. 
See: 
https://www.etsi.org/standards/standards-making

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
ETSI’s standards-making process has been clearly defined after years of experience. The organisation has adopted the open approach which means direct participation and consensus as a basis to develop standards. All the stakeholders have the opportunity to participate directly in the process of standardisation through the technical committees created to develop ETSI’s technical specifications and standards. The decision-making process includes a public review, where stakeholders involved can provide technical feedback in order to enhance and maximize the quality and accuracy of the standards. 

See: 
https://www.etsi.org/standards/standards-making

statement:
XAdES Baseline Profile is an open standards developed and maintained by ETSI, and it is available for free at ETSI’s webpage for everyone to study or implement. 
See:  
https://www.etsi.org/standards

criterion_description: The standard or specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
ETSI’s Intellectual Property Rights Policy is based on Standard Essential Patents (SEP). The policy implemented by the standardisation organisation seeks to reduce risks and ensure that the standards are available under (F) RAND basis and Royalty-free, it means with no cost or fee to be paid when possible. 
See: 
https://www.etsi.org/intellectual-property-rights

criterion_description: The standard or specification is licensed on a royalty-free basis
statement:
ETSI’s Intellectual Property Rights Policy is based on Standard Essential Patents (SEP). The policy implemented by the standardisation organisation seeks to reduce risks and ensure that the standards are available under (F) RAND basis and Royalty-free, meaning its costless or with the most optimum fee for the function that will be used.
See: 
https://www.etsi.org/intellectual-property-rights

criterion_description: The standard or specification is sufficiently mature and has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
XAdED Baseline Profile provides basic authentication and integrity protection and satisfies the legal requirements for advanced electronic signatures as defined in the European Directive.

See:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/103100_103199/103171/02.01.01_60/ts_103171v020101p.pdf

statement: XAdES Baseline Profile does not foster the creation of innovative solutions.

criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of administrative rules, processes, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement: XAdES Baseline Profile function is to facilitate the electronic signature in compliance with eIDAS, so it can be concluded that through it processes, data and services are fostered.

criterion_description: The standard or specification helps ensuring the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement: The purpose of the specification is not related to the availability interfaces. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.
statement: XAdES Baseline Profile is a business sector agnostic specification which is reusable beyond the domain for which it was developed. Specifically, implemented to facilitate the electronic signature in compliance with eIDAS.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard has been made available for its reuse by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.
statement:
XAdES Baseline Profile function is to facilitate the electronic signature in compliance with eIDAS, campliant with the European Directive of electronic signature of the European Parliament and the Council.

See:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/103100_103199/103171/02.01.01_60/ts_103171v020101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard or specification is independent from any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
XAdES Baseline Profile is built over XML and its constraints. Even though, as XML is an open standard widely used the implementation of the specification does not hamper the interoperability of systems. 
See:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/103100_103199/103171/02.01.01_60/ts_103171v020101p.pdf

criterion_description: The standard or specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
XAdES Baseline Profile accomplishes with the European Directive of electronic signature of the European Parliament and the Council to allow the electronic signature through eIDAS, so it can be deducted that the needs are proportionate to the users needs.

See:
https://www.w3.org/TR/XAdES/

criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement: The purpose of the specification is not related to portability between systems and applications. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
The application of the once-only principle in all EU Member States public administrations aims at reducing the administrative burden. To achieve this, interoperability between public administrations is a sine qua non condition.

XAdES function is to facilitate the electronic signature in compliance with eIDAS, campliant with the European Directive of electronic signature of the European Parliament and the Council. Concequently it can be concluded that through this functions it promotes the once-only principle

criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement: The purpose of the specification is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement: XAdES is part of the electronic signature stack of specifications, this group of specifications are aimed to ensure the availability and validation of signed data. Therefore, the implementation of eSignatures involving XAdES fosters secure and trustworthy data exchange.

statement: The purpose of the specification is not related to the delivery of multilingual services. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The adoption of the standard or specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement: XAdES is part of the electronic signature stack of specifications, this group of specifications are aimed to ensure the availability and validation of signed data. Concquently, the implementation of eSignatures reduces the administratives burdens of the administration.

statement: The purpose of XAdES is not related  to the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

statement:
There are document of the European Comission assessing the suitability of XAdES specification.

See:
 https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/DSS/webapp-demo/doc/dss-documentation.html#_xades_profiles

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard or specification can be mapped to the EIRA.
statement:
XAdES Baseline Profile is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). Specifically, ASiC Baseline Profile can define the interoperability aspects of “e-Seal Creation Service”, “e- Verification Seal and Validation Service”, “e-Signature Creation Service”, and “e-signature Verification and Validation Service” ABBs of the EIRA Technical View.
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/distribution/eliscataloguev100betaxlsx

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the standard or specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
XAdES has provided a conformance testing tool for electronic signatures according to the European Commission Mandate 460. The conformity testing tool involves different standards applied in the development of eSignatures, including PAdES, CAdES and ASiC ant their respective Baseline profiles . 

See:
https://signatures-conformance-checker.etsi.org/pub/ASiCConformanceTestChecker_v1.0.pdf
https://signatures-conformance-checker.etsi.org/pub/index.shtml

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is recommended by a EU Member State.
statement: XAdES is within the European eIDAS regulation which is legally binding for all EU members states.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been selected for its use in a EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
XAdES Baseline profile has been selected within the CEF Digital Signature Service (hereby DSS) along with CAdES, ASiC and PAdES Baseline profiles.  

Digital Signature Service is an open-source software library for electronic signature creation and validation supporting the interoperability of electronic signatures. The initiative is an enabler for cross borders interoperability between administrations and businesses.

See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/Standards+and+specifications
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/DSS/webapp-demo/doc/dss-documentation.html
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=82773260

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
XAdES is included in several national catalogues from Member States. A total of 7 countries listed the XAdES within their national catalogues.

See CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
XAdES Baseline Profile is included in the ETSI’s catalogue of standards. As ETSI is considered an official standardisation organisation, it can be considered that the specifications are included in a supra-national catalogue.   
See: 
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/103100_103199/103174/02.02.01_60/ts_103174v020201p.pdf
https://www.etsi.org/standards

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
In the context of eSignatures and Seals, the European Commission has stated an Implementing decision (2015/1506)  where urged the Member States and other Public services providers to recognise CAdES, PAdES, XAdES, and ASIC as formats for electronic signatures purposes. 
  
See: 
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX:32015D1506

statement:

See: 
https://www.etsi.org/about/etsi-in-europe

statement: XAdES does not provide a cross sector reusable data model per se. The specification provides a set of conformance level for the basic features in the context of the European Internal Market.

criterion_description: The standard or specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
XAdES Baseline Profile is referenced in the ETSI collection at the European Platform Joinup. Moreover, it can be found for free at ETSI’s webpage
See:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/electronic-signatures-and-infrastructures-esi-xml-advanced-electronic-signature-formats-xades-part-3
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/103100_103199/103174/02.02.01_60/ts_103174v020201p.pdf
